Its got 38 base AB which is enough to be useful as a support character but he won't be really a damage dealer sadly except maybe ILMS wand spam?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Nice try, Orion - but no.

If your balletic beardmeister is so agile and nimble, would I be right in thinking you won't be using Defensive Stance at all? You know, that thing where you stand stock-still and simply hit stuff and shrug off flies...

Of course, if you don't want to use Def Stance, that's fine - but then, why 18 levels in DwD? You only need Defensive Awareness II (DwD level 5) to effectively be sneak-immune. I did it myself with Truesilver's Hand . But that was never meant to be a party tank, or why take HiPS?

Please don't get me wrong, a Dex-based DwD is absolutely a fine idea (why would you need Dodge otherwise?). Just don't equip them with a toothpick. It's just very very wrong.

posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: ↑
Nov 29, 2019
Would I be right in thinking you won't be using Defensive Stance at all? You know, that thing where you stand stock-still and simply hit stuff and shrug off flies...

Of course, if you don't want to use Def Stance, that's fine - but then, why 18 levels in DwD? You only need Defensive Awareness II (DwD level 5) to effectively be sneak-immune. 
He'll use it when he's doing his ballet like pose when seducing his elven love (hehe I think I'm going to give Stag nightmares about bearded potbellied Dwarven ballet dancers)

The 18 levels in DwD are for Epic Dwarven Defender Damage Resistance 12/-, which can stack with damage resistance belts like Greater Swordsman's Belts etc, its pretty nice combined with crit and sneak immunity, makes this tank pretty hard to kill, even if you can hit him in the first place. DwD also has d12 hit die which is very nice. The Defensive stance is ok for the +4 dodge AC, the stats are also good early on but not so great later when stats can get capped. 

That being said, I've had a brief look at Thax's guide to Dwarven Defenders again and I've found some things I'm still not doing optimally so I might have to make some modifications to the build which I'll look into when I have some time! For example I don't think epic warding and the damage reduction stacks so I might as well ditch EW to see if I can get that DR to around 20 +

Edit:
Redid the build, dropped EW and added EDR x3 at the cost of 2AB (which may or may not matter). Put in some set trap skills from removing some points from spellcraft now EW is not needed.

Has DR 21/- now which should tank a very large proportion of any enemy's physical melee attack, particularly now that they can't critically hit you. 

AC can get to 10 +8 (dex) +4 (tumble) +2 (AS) +10 (PM16) +20 (EMA) +4 (defensive stance) without items = 58 AC. Add +5 robes, +5 tower and capped dexterity (+6) its 74 AC.

Magical/elemental damage is still a problem, death immunity will need to be cast from party members or by equipping that belt of guiding light

A bard PM DD would have a much better AB but there are alignment issues there
